member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeDefaultConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration for accessing Amazon BedrockDataAutomationRuntime service

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by BedrockDataAutomationRuntime

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon BedrockDataAutomationRuntime endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of BedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for BedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon BedrockDataAutomationRuntime endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for BedrockDataAutomationRuntime service requests. Collects values for BedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses BedrockDataAutomationRuntimeEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing BedrockDataAutomationRuntime
Amazon Bedrock Data Automation Runtime

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockDataAutomationRuntime.AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBedrockDataAutomationRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
